macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Rise on Monday, Recovering Last Week's Losses
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.5% to 6,950.23, Dow gained 0.6% to 49,412.40, and Nasdaq added 0.4% to 23,601.36, rebounding from prior dips amid gains in energy and AI sectors.

items.title: Baker Hughes Shares Surge on Strong Quarterly Profit
items.summary: Baker Hughes led gains with a 4.4% rise after reporting stronger-than-expected profits, driven by demand for liquefied natural gas.

items.title: CoreWeave Climbs After Nvidia's $2 Billion Investment
items.summary: CoreWeave stock rose 5.7% following Nvidia's announcement of a $2 billion investment to expand AI factories using Nvidia chips by 2030.

items.title: Gold Hits Record High Above $5,100 per Ounce
items.summary: Gold prices briefly topped $5,100 per ounce for the first time, with silver surging even more sharply, while the US dollar weakened against major currencies.

items.title: Fed Rate Decision Expected Wednesday Amid Stubborn Inflation
items.summary: Markets anticipate the Federal Reserve to hold interest rates steady on Wednesday due to inflation above the 2% target, with Chair Jerome Powell's comments potentially impacting stocks and bonds.

items.title: Major Tech Earnings Due This Week from Meta, Microsoft, Tesla, Apple
items.summary: Key earnings reports are scheduled this week, including Meta Platforms, Microsoft, and Tesla on Wednesday, and Apple on Thursday.

items.title: Upcoming US Economic Data: Durable Goods Orders and Case-Shiller HPI
items.summary: Key releases this week include Monday's preliminary November durable goods orders (consensus +1.0%) and Tuesday's S&P/Case-Shiller home price index.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Ripple Partners with DXC Technology to Integrate Blockchain into Core Banking
items.summary: Ripple announced a collaboration with DXC Technology to integrate its blockchain technology and digital asset solutions into DXC's Hogan core banking platform, which supports $5 trillion in deposits across 300 accounts worldwide. The partnership aims to enable banks to offer secure, compliant digital asset use cases at enterprise scale.

items.title: XRP Community Day Announced for February 11 with CEO Brad Garlinghouse
items.summary: Ripple announced that XRP Community Day will launch on February 11, featuring a fireside chat with CEO Brad Garlinghouse. The event marks a significant engagement initiative for the XRP community.

items.title: Bitcoin Stalls at $88K Amid Market Mixed Performance
items.summary: Bitcoin traded between $87,036 and $89,010 over the past 24 hours, currently at $87,984 with a 0.20% gain. The global cryptocurrency market cap stands at $2.97 trillion, up 0.38% in 24 hours, with markets remaining cautious ahead of Federal Reserve decisions.

items.title: Clarity Act Advances as Senator Withdraws Contested Amendment
items.summary: The Clarity Act, bipartisan legislation to regulate and legitimize digital assets, overcame a major obstacle when a Senator withdrew a contested amendment. The Senate Agriculture Committee is expected to vote on the bill Thursday morning, bringing the crypto industry closer to regulatory clarity.

items.title: XRP ETF Inflows Reach $1.24 Billion Cumulatively
items.summary: XRP exchange-traded products have generated cumulative net inflows of approximately $1.24 billion since launch, with Canary Capital's XRPC accounting for $346 million and Bitwise's XRP at $324 million. XRP is currently trading at $1.8851, down from recent highs.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: BullFrog AI Releases White Paper on Data Harmonization for Reliable AI/ML in Life Sciences
items.summary: BullFrog AI published a white paper emphasizing data harmonization as essential for effective AI/ML in biopharma, introducing their bfPREP™ tool to standardize noisy data for better clinical trial outcomes.

items.title: Researchers Use AI to Optimize Quantum Field Theory Simulations
items.summary: A team from TU Wien and collaborators developed AI-designed lattice formulations that enhance accuracy and efficiency of quantum field theory simulations, reducing computational costs while preserving physical properties.

items.title: Databricks Report Reveals 327% Surge in AI Agent Adoption Amid Governance Challenges
items.summary: Databricks' 2026 State of AI Agents report shows explosive growth in multi-agent workflows, with 40% of use cases in customer experience, though only 19% of organizations have scaled deployment due to governance issues.

items.title: UAE Job Postings Show Rapid Rise in AI Skills Demand
items.summary: Stanford's 2025 AI Index Report indicates UAE job descriptions requiring AI skills like NLP, machine learning, and generative AI rose from under 1% in 2021 to 1.7%, nearing US levels.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Geoff Keighley Denies Financial Stake in Highguard Amid Controversy
items.summary: Geoff Keighley refuted conspiracy theories claiming he has a financial interest in the new shooter Highguard, launched by Wildlight on January 26, which peaked at 97,000 concurrent Steam users despite backlash from its Game Awards reveal. Developers explained the reveal was a pivot from a shadowdrop plan and urged support for the live-service shooter.

items.title: Valve Faces £656 Million UK Lawsuit Over Steam Commissions
items.summary: A British tribunal ruled that Valve must face a massive lawsuit alleging excessive commissions on Steam sales since 2018, affecting up to 14 million UK consumers by locking purchases to the platform and preventing cheaper rival sales.

items.title: Shift Up CEO Cites Chinese Competition as Reason for AI Adoption
items.summary: Shift Up's CEO Hyung-tae Kim, director of Stellar Blade, stated the need for AI in development due to China's massive teams of 1,000-2,000 per game versus their 150, though critics argue China is not dominantly leading in quality or revenue.

items.title: Upcoming Game Releases: Code Vein II, Cairn, and More This Week
items.summary: Notable releases include Code Vein II on PC/PS5/Xbox Series X|S January 30, Cairn on PC/PS5 (already out January 20), I Hate This Place on January 29, Front Mission 3 Remake on January 30, and Switch 2 titles like Dispatch and GRID Legends Deluxe.

items.title: Highguard Developers Address Hostile Reception Post-Game Awards
items.summary: Wildlight's CEO Dusty Welch discussed the shooter's challenging Game Awards reveal, originally planned as a shadowdrop like Apex Legends, emphasizing the genre's strong market potential despite competition.

items.title: Canadian Game Awards Partners with XP Game Summit for 2026 Gala
items.summary: The Canadian Game Awards and XP Gaming Inc. announced a strategic partnership, with the 2026 gala set for May alongside the XP Game Summit in Toronto.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Meta and Microsoft Earnings Expected to Drive Market Sentiment
items.summary: Investors are closely watching earnings reports from Meta and Microsoft this week to assess whether major tech companies will continue their significant spending on technology infrastructure that has fueled recent market growth.

items.title: State Lawmakers Focus on Tech Policy Trends Including AI, Social Media, and Data Privacy
items.summary: State lawmakers are prioritizing tech policy initiatives around artificial intelligence, social media regulation, and data privacy protections to safeguard users and ensure technology serves the public interest.
